results.title: The 18-year risk of cancer, angioedema, insomnia, depression, and erectile dysfunction in association with antihypertensive drugs: post-trial analyses from ALLHAT-Medicare linked data
results.text_hl: The adjusted 18-year risk of @DISEASE_Angioedema @DISEASE_MESH:D000799 @@@angioedema@@@ was elevated in those receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ than in those receiving @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (hazard ratio: 1.63, 95% CI: 1.14-2.33) or in those receiving @CHEMICAL_Chlorthalidone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002752 @@@chlorthalidone@@@ (1.33, 1.00-1.79), whereas the adjusted 18-year risk of @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Initiation_and_Maintenance_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007319 @@@insomnia@@@ was statistically significantly decreased in those receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ than in those receiving @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ (0.90, 0.81-1.00).

citations.NLM: Du XL, Martinez J, Yamal JM, Simpson LM, Davis BR. The 18-year risk of cancer, angioedema, insomnia, depression, and erectile dysfunction in association with antihypertensive drugs: post-trial analyses from ALLHAT-Medicare linked data Front Cardiovasc Med. 2023;10():1272385. PMID: 38045916
